website_summaries.verdict: The Saucony Redeemer ISO is a stability running shoe with a plushy cushioning. With the overall construction that performs well on the road, this running shoe is a superb option for overpronators. Some users are happy with the shoe's performance but others are disappointed. Overall, the Redeemer ISO still has room for improvement.
pros: The upper of the Redeemer features the ISOFIT technology for comfortable and sock-like feel
The Saucony Redeemer ISO provides a supportive ride without affecting flexibility as noted in some reviews
Most runners took note of how comfortable the Redeemer is
A few users found the shoe very durable
cons: Based on some comments, this shoe felt a bit heavy

customer_reviews.title: Solution to this nurse's pronation problem
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for work. I am a nurse and walk about 12,000 steps per 12 hour shift as a rapid response team nurse. I took these to work expecting to change into my already broken in shoes after a couple hours, but wore these right out of the box for 12 hours and 11000 steps. My feet were a little sore, but would be with any shoes after the busy shift I had. I am glad that I have found the Saucony brand. I have pronation problems (my ankles turn in) and these shoes are the best I've found.
customer_reviews.author: norbyte

customer_reviews.title: One year in with these shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these shoes Dec 12 of last year so it's been a year. Motion control shoes are a must for this avid runner. I run 30 + miles a week and have severe over pronation problems. Usually by this point I start getting knee problems when it's time to change out the shoes. Surprisingly, I have yet to start getting any issues in regards to changing out my shoes. They wear well and I've had no issues to speak of from this brand. I will be purchasing these shoes again, and soon since I'd rather not get any injuries or knee problems in the meantime.
customer_reviews.author: raquel

customer_reviews.title: Best sneaker brand I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Best sneaker brand I have ever owned. This is my third pair, worth the $$. As a person will awful foot problems these sneakers have the right amount of support and cushioning in all the right places. Plenty of room in the toe box and wide width is awesome. Very happy with purchased. Delivery was fast. However, seller required signature at delivery which was not mentioned in the offer on Amazon. Had to make arrangements for someone to be home was a tab bite inconvenient for a pair of sneakers.
customer_reviews.author: missmaui

customer_reviews.title: Bulky and heavy
customer_reviews.text: I’m an average runner ( 20-25 miles per week) always looking for shoes with more support for my overpronation. This shoe somehow feels really heavy and slowed me down a lot during my first 4 mile run with them. The shoe itself is pretty bulky, the support works really well and my feet feel really locked while wearing them. I probably have to really break them and get my feet and legs to get used to them.
customer_reviews.author: xime1282

customer_reviews.title: Squeaky and Ugly
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, Saucony discontinued my go-to shoe, Stabil CS. I ordered several different brands of running shoes, but these Redeemers were the only ones that fit, so I kept them. Unfortunately, my orthotics squeak in them so much that I won't wear them together. Additionally, the shoe is ugly and pretty darn heavy. Since I have kept them beyond the return period, I guess I'll be using them for gardening and not much else. :( For those not needing custom orthotics, the foot liner that comes with the shoe is very, very cushy.
customer_reviews.author: Rose K

customer_reviews.title: Big ASICS convert!
customer_reviews.text: If you would have asked me several years ago which running sneaker brand I prefer for my feet, I wouldn't have hesitated to say ASICS. However, over the years, my feet haven't been too happy. I just wasn't getting the over pronation control, stability, support and comfort I needed so desperately. After researching Saucony and this particular sneaker, I was hopeful, and it's paid off big time! The Redeemer ISO has become my saving grace. Definitely needed 1/2 size up. For me personally, the muted grey with a splash of green is right in my wheelhouse. Thanks to Saucony, I can keep up with my daily workouts! Soooo very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Truthteller

customer_reviews.title: Great!!
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are awesome. I bought them for overpronation and turf toe, and they have been amazing!! They are a bit bulkier than my other sauconys, but the support system is on par with all of the fancier shoes for a cheaper price. I do not find them very much heavier than my other shoes. very comfortable and unbendable. Also didn't realize that the fabric underlay is navy blue and not black. Very nice shoes.
customer_reviews.author: The King

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these based on 5 minutes of research in hopes that they would not kill my feet at Disney World. They are AWESOME! They were comfortable from the minute I put them on. I'm a heavier gal and we did some serious walking so I'm 100% these shoes are worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good replacement model
customer_reviews.text: I loved the Saucony Women's Stabil CS3 Running Shoe, but they were discontinued So contacted Saucony to learn what they were selling in its place and that is the Redeemer Iso its the next generation of stable running shoe from Saucony. The Redeemer is a very good replacement. I'm very satisfied and will buy it again..
customer_reviews.author: Marie Greco

customer_reviews.title: Super stability shoe
customer_reviews.text: Ok, truth is I ordered theses from Zappos and sent them back about a year ago because I just couldn’t accept needing such a big looking shoe! Foot pain forward I gave I and tried them again! They really are very supportive and control motion which is what I need currently with a torn foot tendon. Although they look bulky they are very light. I recognize that my earlier vanity probably made my foot pain worse — don’t be me!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: IDEAL FOR FLAT FEET + STABILITY
customer_reviews.text: Saucony is the best shoe if you have flat feet because of the stability. Yeah, the sole is kinda clunky looking but I don't care since they feel amazing to wear. It'd be nice if in the women's shoes they used red or blue instead of pinks, purples and pastels....this mint green isn't my jam. I've been a loyal Saucony running shoe wearer for over 5 years and am never disappointed with the fit, comfort and longevity. Also, my doctor-prescribed orthotics fit inside!
customer_reviews.author: SaladEatingCat

customer_reviews.title: Saucony Womens Redeemer I so Running shoe
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted my pink trim and dark gray Saucony, but my favorite shoes weren't available. These are a different style and color, but still these are so comfortable too, fit as expected. I have 4 pairs of Saucony running shoes and only buy Saucony now. My feet and knees no longer hurt, I am able to go farther with comfort. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: love's shoes

customer_reviews.title: I always ordered a wide shoe from Saucony but this ...
customer_reviews.text: I always ordered a wide shoe from Saucony but this one is extremely wide. I have tightened the laces as much as I can and I will next try an insole to see if that helps. The classic running shoes are a thing of the past. These hurt my feet but I cannot return because I have already taken a run with them.
customer_reviews.author: Mer

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoes for People with Flat Feet
customer_reviews.text: I have wide feet, and the Wide size fits my feet perfectly. Really comfortable, and a ton of support. They also help me prevent rolling my ankles. Worth the money, and they've lasted longer than some specialty shoes made for people with flat feet.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: First let me say that I love Saucony shoes -- I rarely wear anything else
customer_reviews.text: First let me say that I love Saucony shoes -- I rarely wear anything else. I've also ordered from Amazon in the past and have gotten great shoes. These looked good because of the extra arch support -- I wanted a shoe that didn't require me to wear orthotics. However, this particular model is wider than those I've gotten in the past, and I am returning them. I intend to go to a running shoe store to get properly fitted for my next pair.
customer_reviews.author: Amy B.

customer_reviews.title: They seem to be very supportive & comfortable. I put the extra green laces in them ...
customer_reviews.text: At 1st I was going to send back. Only because of the clunky look to the inside arches. Reminds me of orthodox old people shoes. Well, I decided to give them a go. Have walked over 6 miles for 2 days in them. They seem to be very supportive & comfortable. I put the extra green laces in them for a sporty look. Not bad! I will rotate them with my Brooks transcend running shoes I love!
customer_reviews.author: Deborah

customer_reviews.title: Really love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: Really love these shoes! I usually purchase Brooks Ariel, but was looking for something with a little color, which is not easy to find in a motion control shoe. It's kind of like we're punished because we overpronate. I saw these - black and purple - wow! I'm glad I switched - these are great shoes, very comfortable and they look great! I'm very happy with the Redeemer ISO.
customer_reviews.author: Anne A.

customer_reviews.title: Great, especially for flat feet
customer_reviews.text: My podiatrist recommended this specific model of this shoe because of my pronation. I was skeptical, but they have been really great. The insole is removable and there is plenty of room for my orthotics. My ankle pain has improved and I am able to walk greater distances. I wish they came in all black so that I could wear them with work clothes (black pants etc.). Very recommended if you have flat feet.
customer_reviews.author: Carolina Cat

customer_reviews.title: So glad Amazon still had these as all the stores around ...
customer_reviews.text: So glad Amazon still had these as all the stores around here did not have my size in this particular color and would not be able to get them until July. They fit great and the correction is perfect. I usually wear the Brooks Ariel and these are very comparable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Smaller then expected.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the exact same shoe from a running store and these shoes do not fit the same. They are tight and give me shin splints. I stopped wearing them.
customer_reviews.author: Jemski

customer_reviews.title: I have flat feet and these work well.
customer_reviews.text: I have the fattest feet ever, no arch at all. My footprints in the sand look like someone is snowshoeing across the beach. These shoes have decreased my foot pain and are so comfy. I can run in them or workout at the gym. One thing that takes some getting used to is how heavy they are, but I really like these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Good PTTD shoes.
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes. Nice and wide for toe room. I wear with a replaced insert for flat feet. I have been wearing the Brooks Ariel. Another good PTTD shoe but a bit more narrow in front so my size 11 Med. Feet look even bigger in them.Med. Saw these Saucony shoes at a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Great running shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Saucony Grid Stabils had been my running shoe choice for years. I was concerned when that model was discontinued and replaced with the Redeemer. However the Redeemer has worked out very well. I'm very satisfied with this model.
customer_reviews.author: Deanna B

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for pttd
customer_reviews.text: Have pttd and this shoe helps immensely. Once I started wearing these shoes with my brace it took most of my pain away. I just ordered a second pair, keeping one for everyday and one for good. Wish I would have found these shoes sooner
customer_reviews.author: Tj

customer_reviews.title: They recommended this as a replacement for it
customer_reviews.text: The toe box seems a little smaller even though I ordered my regular size 8. The shoes don't seem to "breathe" as well as the Stabil CS3. I can feel the heat around my feet and can't wait to take them off after my run because of this. I sure wish the company had not discontinued the Stabil. They recommended this as a replacement for it, but I am not that happy with it. It does have good cushioning. Time will tell if they help with my knee issues or not.
customer_reviews.author: Betty Castro

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful shoes
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes. I have awful bunions and usually need to add a metatarsal pad in every shoe. It might be nice on these, but I've never bothered. Because I read that they have a wide toe box, I did not order a wide to accommodate the bunions. I did have to reorder one half size longer to get the right fit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great fit for price, don't waste your money on NB or Asics.
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this shoe! It's even better than the Grid, in my estimation. It's slightly better sized/shaped to fit flat feet than before. AND it was less expensive than NB or Asics that were comparably described. Am very satisfied with this purchase and am glad they finally came out with some 'tough' colors. Highly Recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Doc mom

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: Excellent support, plenty of room for my orthotics, nice wide toe-bed (so hard to find in athletic shoes, not sure why), AND I finally have a pair of shoes that are pretty much all-black (also hard to find).
customer_reviews.author: dlg

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic shoe!!! SUPER comfortable and can be used with an insert/orthotics. I have extremely flat feet and these are the most comfortable and supportive shoe I've purchased yet!
customer_reviews.author: MH

customer_reviews.title: Poor fit
customer_reviews.text: Too wide, had to return it. I loved Saucony Stabil, wore them for years. Now they don't make that style anymore, and this is a poor substitute.
customer_reviews.author: H. MacKenzie

customer_reviews.title: Very very happy with shoes and service and price!!
customer_reviews.text: Prompt delivery. Quality shoe. I chose this shoe because I wanted and needed a stability shoe. I walk 6-8 miles 4-5x weekly. Also: The leather overlay is placed in such a way that it does not chafe my small toe-something that is increasingly hard to find. My only lament is that the toe cage is over wide--and I have uncommonly wide feet for a woman
customer_reviews.author: L.H.

customer_reviews.title: I love the shoes
customer_reviews.text: Received 9/27/16. I love the shoes, but not thrilled that both shoes have holes already(same place on both shoes) and there's no apparent reason for them :(
customer_reviews.author: Gigglebyte66

customer_reviews.title: This shoe has a wide toe box and is very comfortable for running
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of redeemers, which I switched to after brooks changed the Ariel and made it too narrow. This shoe has a wide toe box and is very comfortable for running.
customer_reviews.author: acs

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: Terrific shoe. I wear orthotics in them with ample room. Very comfy, lightweight for an all day wear.
customer_reviews.author: Teacher lady

customer_reviews.title: Buy bigger than you think you need
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes, but had to buy a size one and a half bigger than normal. Once I got the right size, they are great. Comfortable, good insole support, could walk all day in them. They should consider standardizing their sizes with other big manufacturers. Would save consumers and suppliers a lot of money on returns and shipping fees.
customer_reviews.author: Debra P

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable true size
customer_reviews.text: Great fit! Great comfort. I used them for flat feet and they support my arches amazingly well. Great buy! I am size 7 (Nike/adidas etc.) Size 7 fits me perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Ash

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work out this time....
customer_reviews.text: I like this brand but for some reason the shoe did not fit well, I tried thin socks and then thicker socks and nothing seemed to help. The shoe just did not fell well. It is a nice looking shoe, seemed made well, not sure what the problem was, but do plan to give Saucony another chance in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Icicie So. Cal

customer_reviews.title: My foot surgeon recommended this shoe since I broke 3 metatarsal bones on ...
customer_reviews.text: My foot surgeon recommended this shoe since I broke 3 metatarsal bones on my left foot. I am a size 9 shoe and ordered this sneaker in size 9. Fit was perfect. Tremendous support and comfort. Like walking on air.
customer_reviews.author: nycchic

customer_reviews.title: I really overpronate and am flat footed
customer_reviews.text: I really overpronate and I am completely flatfooted. I normally can only wear Brooks addiction, but these worked. I will order them again
customer_reviews.author: lkelly9988

customer_reviews.title: Arkansas lady
customer_reviews.text: I should have ordered my normal size, 7.5, but my other two pair, same , are 8's. Great for mobility protection and wide enough for bunions. The shoe is very well made, it was just my mistake. It should be a "5" star:))
customer_reviews.author: Arkansas ladyl

customer_reviews.title: Bummed
customer_reviews.text: These shoes give me an ingrown toenail. It is odd shaped on one foot and pokes the inside of my big toe.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoes!
customer_reviews.text: These shoes fit comfortably out of the box. The C/D size accommodated bunions and orthothics. I didn't give it 5 stars because of the busy mix of colors. Black, purple and silver/gray look good, but not the white midsole. I think the shoes would've looked much better with a gray midsole.
customer_reviews.author: Jan S

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but heavy
customer_reviews.text: These sneakers are very comfortable. However, they felt a bit clunky because of their size and weight, especially for someone who wears a 10.5.
customer_reviews.author: CelineC

customer_reviews.title: I love them
customer_reviews.text: I strive to be an avid runner and I'm well on my way with these new Saucony. I have extreme flat feet and these shoes are wonderful for my long distance running.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The store is in our area didn't have any in stock-- we were pleased and surprised to see them on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: My wife uses these shoes as stability shoes, keeps her feet from rolling, and helps with knee pain. The store is in our area didn't have any in stock-- we were pleased and surprised to see them on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best shoes for HIT workout and running
customer_reviews.text: The most Amazing shoes I’ve ever owned. It is well cushioned with good arch support and Roomy around the toes. Good pronator support
customer_reviews.author: paola salgueiro

customer_reviews.title: I have plantar fasciitis and I really like the Saucony Grid but they don't have new styles ...
customer_reviews.text: I have plantar fasciitis and I really like the Saucony Grid but they don't have new styles out so I went with this Redeemer and it's a nice shoe. Comfortable, wide enough, cushion and the colors are not boring compared to most stability shoes on the market.
customer_reviews.author: ShortMama

customer_reviews.title: These shoes are fantastic - sturdy but light
customer_reviews.text: Am suffering from posterior tubular tedonitis and have been looking for stability shoes with arch support. These shoes are fantastic - sturdy but light, strong arch support! I don't even need inserts!!
customer_reviews.author: Linda G. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Definitely not worth $140 if they only last six weeks.
customer_reviews.text: One Star rating because the material on the side of the shoe after wearing for six weeks already has a hole in them. This seems like a manufacturing defect because the material is pulled from the seam. Definitely not worth $140 if they only last six weeks.
customer_reviews.author: April Woodruff

customer_reviews.title: Ready to walk it off!
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are exactly what I needed and expected! So far these ISO Redeemers are helping with my over-pronation and supporting my very flat arches. I look forward to wearing these shoes as I increase my physical activity and undo some of the damage that's been done carrying around excess weight for so long. Allons-y!
customer_reviews.author: Susan R Banks

customer_reviews.title: Great for mild over pronation too
customer_reviews.text: I was a little worried that they would be too supportive as I think I really just have mild over-pronation, but right out of the box they were very comfortable and I know I made the right choice. I also got them with a great deal through Amazon Warehouse Deals, which I also highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Runs small
customer_reviews.text: I had to return them because the sneakers felt at least a 1/2 size (possibly a full size) too small. I wear a size 10 and my toe was at the very top of these sneakers.
customer_reviews.author: MLL

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE these running shoes
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE these running shoes. I am a veteran runner in my early 30's. I require significant padding and support to prevent shin splints and other injuries. This is my second pair of these shoes. I have tried many brands, but these are by far my favorite!
customer_reviews.author: Tara

customer_reviews.title: I have tried other Motion control shoes and these are by far the best shoes I have been able to find
customer_reviews.text: Bilateral plantar fasciitis with tarsal tunnel and these shoes are able to make it tolerable. I have tried other Motion control shoes and these are by far the best shoes I have been able to find.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Klumper

customer_reviews.title: Performs well
customer_reviews.text: I have worn Saucony for years and this is the first Saucony in size 11 that is a little large in the toe box and yet the tongue is very short is hard to tie a bow with the laces which seem shorter also.
customer_reviews.author: kim

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I could've gone into the Wide, but wasn't available. I will have to stretch it out.
customer_reviews.author: Kailua Girl

customer_reviews.title: I could not find the Saucony Grid Nitro 2 that was my favorite but the Redeemer will be great for the cobblestones ...
customer_reviews.text: This shoe fits as expected according to the reviews that I had. I could not find the Saucony Grid Nitro 2 that was my favorite but the Redeemer will be great for the cobblestones in Israel.
customer_reviews.author: PK

customer_reviews.title: As always I love Saucony as the toe box is wide enough
customer_reviews.text: As always I love Saucony as the toe box is wide enough. With this particular one I didn't even have to get the wide width...wear them all day long...7+miles usually.
customer_reviews.author: nan

customer_reviews.title: Great for flat feet
customer_reviews.text: Great for flat feet, but runs small. My size recommendation said 7, but my toes hit the front of the shoes uncomfortably.
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: Most important the insteep was not too tight across my foot like the Hurricanes were
customer_reviews.text: Lots of support, just what I was looking for. Most important the insteep was not too tight across my foot like the Hurricanes were. The pain and tiredness was gone from my feet and legs as soon as I started wearing the Redeemers. Only place I could find the Redeemers was on Amazon. Have already ordered a back-up pair.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Ellison

customer_reviews.title: Ugly design
customer_reviews.text: These are not a suitable replacement for the omni's. These look like Herman Munster shoes in person.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie P

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes, especially for people with no arches. If you have flat feet, shoes with arches can be very painful. These are great.
customer_reviews.author: Greg L

customer_reviews.title: Not my shoe
customer_reviews.text: I wear a size 5 shoe and have feet more towards wide then normal but these suckers are really wide in the toe box making them feel sloppy. I'm not a runner but I walk several miles nearly every day and have always like Saucony but these are just too wide and too cushy.
customer_reviews.author: R Stephens

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Very bulky high sneaker like wearing heels trip hazard not good for running
customer_reviews.author: Linda Panzella

customer_reviews.title: I want to rate 4.5/5 stars but amazon wont let me do half stars
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable shoes and are handling my over-pronation very well after 2 weeks everyday wear. My largest gripe is the lack of arch support, but is easily remedied with good inserts.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Favorite Saucony by far
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely Love the color of these sneakers! They run about a half size smaller than other saucony shoes so be mindful of that when ordering. Very comfortable with no break in period.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa

customer_reviews.title: Runs Wide
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are very nice but foot bed is too wide for my foot.
customer_reviews.author: J. Adams

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great shoe. It offers a lot of support and is very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Joey

customer_reviews.title: Nope....
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is comfortable and does provide the support it says, however, I think it forces too much of our pronation and my foot kept falling off the foundation of the sole of the sneaker.
customer_reviews.author: Froggie Russell

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe
customer_reviews.text: I have plantar fasciitis and bought these to try out for outdoor walking for fitness. I have walked 3-4 miles in them and had little to no foot pain afterwards, which is a good test for my feet. I bought them in a wide width but they are still a bit narrow in the front of the toe box for me and next time I will size up half a size to accommodate. They are ample through the upper and provide enough room for a tall foot or high arch. They are lightweight enough to be comfortable wearing, but they do have a bulky appearance. Overall a good fitness shoe for tender feet like mine and I would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: stjinnova

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous shoes with so much cushioning for bad knees. I can walk all day in these ...
customer_reviews.text: Fabulous shoes with so much cushioning for bad knees. I can walk all day in these without feeling the least tired. Knees still painful as always but not near as much with these cushioned and corrective Saucony's.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Donovan

customer_reviews.title: Feel great!
customer_reviews.text: Saucony still fits great and gives great arch support. They are pretty pricey, but do the job. I had not bought a pair for a few years, but they still fit the same. I do work out videos at home and I forget that I am even wearing them.
customer_reviews.author: Maria LeJeune

customer_reviews.title: Saucony my go to shoe(s)
customer_reviews.text: Has a wide toe box. Love it. A bit wider than Hurricane II, a little stiffer foot bed as well. Comfortable though with thicker socks..
customer_reviews.author: suzieQ

customer_reviews.title: They are fine though. Better than tight
customer_reviews.text: I returned the first pair and ordered a half-size up because the regular wides were still tightish, but the next size up is kind of biggish. They are fine though. Better than tight.
customer_reviews.author: cavana

customer_reviews.title: I love the Saucony brand but returned these shoes in favor ...
customer_reviews.text: I love the Saucony brand but returned these shoes in favor of the Grid Excursion T9. I have very flat feet and found the Redeemer to have less arch support than desired.
customer_reviews.author: Bikerchick

customer_reviews.title: They fit perfectly but I have a bunion on one ...
customer_reviews.text: They fit perfectly but I have a bunion on one foot and the shoes irritate the area . I have to wear thick socks . I work 12 hour shifts as nurse so comfort is my main goal .
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Breedlove

customer_reviews.title: I really like this shoe
customer_reviews.text: I really like this shoe, it is to wide and I never thought I would be able to say that about a shoe. I will sadly have to return them.
customer_reviews.author: Moriene CargileAmazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and supportive as promised
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and supportive as promised. Did not realise the tongue of the shoe was attached completely to the shoe which might make putting orthodics or different insole difficult.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Tenille Elias

customer_reviews.title: It's good for people whose feet pronate; wears well; supportive and comfy.
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing this sneaker for a couple of years. Like this model better than the ISO 2 -the toe box is a little wider and the shoe accommodates my orthodic better. I was very glad to find this shoe on Amazon; with the new model out this one is no longer in stores near me. It's a great sneaker
customer_reviews.author: anne

customer_reviews.title: Do not like them, the foot bed is too hard and ...
customer_reviews.text: Do not like them, the foot bed is too hard and when putting in a comfy insert makes the shoe too tight. I will be returning these.
customer_reviews.author: Susie Neri

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These are the best sneakers I've ever purchased. Totally worth the extra money.
customer_reviews.author: Kimmy

customer_reviews.title: I have always worn a 10D however the Toe box ...
customer_reviews.text: I have always worn a 10D however the Toe box is to small and it causes toes to rub the sides.
customer_reviews.author: Carla

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable, stability shoe - like it a lot. Like the black color shoes. Thanks for offering different width choices.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stabl C3 Replacement
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty good replacements for the Stabl C3. The foot bed may be just a bit deeper. The shoe seems to have more cushioning.
customer_reviews.author: A RHEA

customer_reviews.title: Great support
customer_reviews.text: Really helped the Plantar Fasciatis. Back problems and over pronation, these shoes felt awesome first time on
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne J. May

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable. True to size
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable. True to size. Sides come up a little higher on my ankle than my nikes did, but hadn’t been a problem.
customer_reviews.author: BG

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great for my walking. Gives good support and makes me feel more confident as I go.
customer_reviews.author: susann96

customer_reviews.title: Great for the overpronator!
customer_reviews.text: Great for the overpronator like me. This version has a wider toe box which gives my toes more room to move and more room to accommodate support/cushioning under my orthotics and Richie Braces. I love these shoes !
customer_reviews.author: Cj

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fits well and is fairly cute, but no arch support ☹️
customer_reviews.author: Shelagh Hafner

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Feet need to get used too. My big toe has a bit of discomfort but heels are fantastic
customer_reviews.author: C Lynn

customer_reviews.title: A disappointing substitute for Stabil
customer_reviews.text: This show was supposed to replace the Stabil. It is very wide in the inside of the shoe but the bottom of the shoe is not as wide as the Stabil; therefore, there is less support for a pronating foot. I returned the shoe and wrote the company that until the Stabil comes back, they have lost a faithful customer. Stabil was the only shoe that made my arches not hurt. Just a few minutes of the Redeemer inside the house let me know that they do not provide the same support.
customer_reviews.author: jane

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Wife's has difficulty finding the right running shoe. She now has 2 pair. Just wish the price was lower.
customer_reviews.author: Joe H

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: They run small and tight. I ordered a 9.5 w and you can not wear them with socks
customer_reviews.author: mac

customer_reviews.title: Support not good!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: The support is not good, I turned my ankle while wearing these and decided they were not a good shoe for my feet.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra S. Jameyson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love it so far, I haven't run in them yet, but they sure feel good walking in them.
customer_reviews.author: Bettie W

customer_reviews.title: Did not disappoint
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as replacement for my Stabil CS3 which I have worn the last 2-3 years. They did not disappoint! Great for my pronation and high arches! Love the stability these provide and the colors are great too!
customer_reviews.author: LeighAnn

customer_reviews.title: Love these
customer_reviews.text: I got the Medium but probably would have been better off getting the Wide. I absolutely love the support as I over pronate and these shoes absorb the impact and help! I'm sold!
customer_reviews.author: dla

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love this shoe but had to order a half size down!
customer_reviews.author: AA

customer_reviews.title: A sturdy comfortable shoes for walking long distances.
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing this shoe for a number of years. My orthotics fits inside and the shoe offers good support.
customer_reviews.author: Carol S.

customer_reviews.title: Love Saucony but not these
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed. They were comfortable for the first couple days (I wear them everyday for work and walk long hours) and after the third day, the inside does not feel soft any longer. They feel hard and compacted to the point it was hurting the back of my calves and the bottom of my feet were so tender, I could barely walk. Unfortunately, I can't return them because I wore them for three days straight, more than 8 hours each day.
customer_reviews.author: ibwolfy

product_meta.title: Saucony Women's Redeemer Iso Running Shoe, Silver/Grey, 5 M US
product_meta.description: ISOFIT upper promotes a sock-like fit. Lace-up closure. Plush tongue and collar. Breathable fabric lining for a great in-shoe feel. Removable foam insole. PWRGRID+ midsole technology provides 20% more cushioning than standard midsoles, for more fluid transitions from heel to toe. TPU pillar in the medial mid-foot supplies added structure and support without the bulk. Midsole Height:Heel/Toe: 29 mm/21 mmDifferential: 8 mm Durable, lightweight IBR+ rubber outsole offers underfoot cushioning.
feature_bullets: Running shoe for severe overpronators featuring ISOFIT upper with sock-like fit
